questions.question_text:
A penetration test was done at a company. After the test, a report was written and given to the company's IT authorities. A section from the report is shown below:
✑ Access List should be written between VLANs.
✑ Port security should be enabled for the intranet.
✑ A security solution which filters data packets should be set between intranet (LAN) and DMZ.
✑ A WAF should be used in front of the web applications.
According to the section from the report, which of the following choice is true?

choices.B: There is access control policy between VLANs.
choices.C: MAC Spoof attacks cannot be performed.
choices.A: A stateful firewall can be used between intranet (LAN) and DMZ.
choices.D: Possibility of SQL Injection attack is eliminated.

discussion.content: The report comment requests "Access List should be written between VLANs." which means it is not in place.

choices.B: Vulnerabilities in the application layer are independent of the network layer. Attacks and mitigation techniques are almost identical.
choices.D: Vulnerabilities in the application layer are greatly different from IPv4.
choices.A: Implementing IPv4 security in a dual-stack network offers protection from IPv6 attacks too.
choices.C: Due to the extensive security measures built in IPv6, application layer vulnerabilities need not be addresses.

discussion.content: All vulnerabilities in the application layer (such as SQL injection or cross-site scripting) are of course independent of the network layer. The attacks and mitigations techniques are strictly identical. The same applies for social engineering attacks such as phishing.

questions.question_text: In IPv6 what is the major difference concerning application layer vulnerabilities compared to IPv4?

A company's Web development team has become aware of a certain type of security vulnerability in their Web software. To mitigate the possibility of this vulnerability being exploited, the team wants to modify the software requirements to disallow users from entering HTML as input into their Web application.
What kind of Web application vulnerability likely exists in their software?

discussion.content: Cross-site scripting, a security exploit in which the attacker inserts malicious client-side code into webpages, has been around since the 1990s and most major websites like Google, Yahoo and Facebook have all been affected by cross-site scripting flaws at some point. Attacks exploiting XSS vulnerabilities can steal data, take control of a user's session, run malicious code, or be used as part of a phishing scam.

Selected Answer: C
C. "GET /restricted/bank.getaccount("˜Ned') HTTP/1.1 Host: westbank.com"

Insecure direct object reference (IDOR) occurs when an application exposes internal object references (such as database keys, filenames, or URLs) without proper authorization or access control checks. Attackers can manipulate these references to access unauthorized resources or perform unauthorized actions.

In option C, the request includes a specific method call, "bank.getaccount('Ned')", indicating an attempt to directly access the account information of user Ned. By specifying the name "Ned" directly in the request, the attacker, Rob, is trying to bypass any authorization or access control mechanisms and retrieve the account information for Ned.

questions.question_text:
Insecure direct object reference is a type of vulnerability where the application does not verify if the user is authorized to access the internal object via its name or key.
Suppose a malicious user Rob tries to get access to the account of a benign user Ned.
Which of the following requests best illustrates an attempt to exploit an insecure direct object reference vulnerability?

discussion.content: on most sites the correct answer is D

comments.content: There are 2 versions for this question. 1 has the "- site:marketing.target.com" and the other one like in this example does not have the "-" which makes C the correct answer here.

discussion.content:
IF D was correct then then question would be the:

Which results will be returned with the following Google search query?
site:target.com -site:Marketing.target.com accounting

So the correct answer is C.

I think the correct answer should be "Results matching "accounting" in domain marketing.target.com but not on the site target.com", which is not listed here.

I tried with the following and the result had pages only on domain "business.facebook.com".

site:facebook.com site:business.facebook.com accounting
Actugoogle goole uses operators(ORS ) on web site or domain
B is correct . Google operator use website or domain

choices.B: Results matching all words in the query.
choices.A: Results from matches on the site marketing.target.com that are in the domain target.com but do not include the word accounting.
choices.D: Results matching "accounting" in domain target.com but not on the site Marketing.target.com
choices.C: Results for matches on target.com and Marketing.target.com that include the word "accounting"

questions.question_text: Which results will be returned with the following Google search query? site:target.com site:Marketing.target.com accounting
